trans-unit.source: How to use the Azure slave plugin with Hudson Continuous Integration
trans-unit.target: How to use the Azure slave plugin with Hudson Continuous Integration

trans-unit.source: Describes how to use Azure slave plugin with Hudson Continuous Integration.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to use Azure slave plugin with Hudson Continuous Integration.

trans-unit.source: How to use the Azure slave plugin with Hudson Continuous Integration
trans-unit.target: How to use the Azure slave plugin with Hudson Continuous Integration

trans-unit.source: The Azure slave plugin for Hudson enables you to provision slave nodes on Azure when running distributed builds.
trans-unit.target: The Azure slave plugin for Hudson enables you to provision slave nodes on Azure when running distributed builds.

trans-unit.source: Install the Azure Slave plugin
trans-unit.target: Install the Azure Slave plugin

trans-unit.source: In the Hudson dashboard, click **Manage Hudson**.
trans-unit.target: In the Hudson dashboard, click **Manage Hudson**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Manage Hudson** page, click on **Manage Plugins**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Manage Hudson** page, click on **Manage Plugins**.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Available** tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Available** tab.

trans-unit.source: Click **Search** and type **Azure** to limit the list to relevant plugins.
trans-unit.target: Click **Search** and type **Azure** to limit the list to relevant plugins.

trans-unit.source: If you opt to scroll through the list of available plugins, you will find the Azure slave plugin under the **Cluster Management and Distributed Build** section in the **Others** tab.
trans-unit.target: If you opt to scroll through the list of available plugins, you will find the Azure slave plugin under the **Cluster Management and Distributed Build** section in the **Others** tab.

trans-unit.source: Select the checkbox for **Azure Slave Plugin**.
trans-unit.target: Select the checkbox for **Azure Slave Plugin**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Install**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Install**.

trans-unit.source: Restart Hudson.
trans-unit.target: Restart Hudson.

trans-unit.source: Now that the plugin is installed, the next steps would be to configure the plugin with your Azure subscription profile and to create a template that will be used in creating the VM for the slave node.
trans-unit.target: Now that the plugin is installed, the next steps would be to configure the plugin with your Azure subscription profile and to create a template that will be used in creating the VM for the slave node.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Azure Slave plugin with your subscription profile
trans-unit.target: Configure the Azure Slave plugin with your subscription profile

trans-unit.source: A subscription profile, also referred to as publish settings, is an XML file that contains secure credentials and some additional information you'll need to work with Azure in your development environment.
trans-unit.target: A subscription profile, also referred to as publish settings, is an XML file that contains secure credentials and some additional information you'll need to work with Azure in your development environment.

trans-unit.source: To configure the Azure slave plugin, you need:
trans-unit.target: To configure the Azure slave plugin, you need:

trans-unit.source: your subscription id
trans-unit.target: your subscription id

trans-unit.source: a Management certificate for your subscription
trans-unit.target: a Management certificate for your subscription

trans-unit.source: These can be found in your subscription profile.
trans-unit.target: These can be found in your subscription profile.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have a copy of your subscription profile, you can download it from [here](https://manage.windowsazure.com/publishsettings/Index?SchemaVersion=2.0).
trans-unit.target: If you don't have a copy of your subscription profile, you can download it from [here](https://manage.windowsazure.com/publishsettings/Index?SchemaVersion=2.0).

trans-unit.source: Below is an example of a subscription profile.
trans-unit.target: Below is an example of a subscription profile.

trans-unit.source: Once you have your subscription profile, follow these steps to configure the Azure slave plugin.
trans-unit.target: Once you have your subscription profile, follow these steps to configure the Azure slave plugin.

trans-unit.source: In the Hudson dashboard, click **Manage Hudson**.
trans-unit.target: In the Hudson dashboard, click **Manage Hudson**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Configure System**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Configure System**.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down the page to find the **Cloud** section.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down the page to find the **Cloud** section.

trans-unit.source: Click **Add new cloud > Microsoft Azure**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add new cloud > Microsoft Azure**.

trans-unit.source: Copy the subscription id and management certificate from your subscription profile and paste them in the appropriate fields.
trans-unit.target: Copy the subscription id and management certificate from your subscription profile and paste them in the appropriate fields.

trans-unit.source: When copying the subscription id and management certificate, **do not** include the quotes that enclose the values.
trans-unit.target: When copying the subscription id and management certificate, **do not** include the quotes that enclose the values.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Verify configuration**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Verify configuration**.

trans-unit.source: When the configuration is verified successfully, click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: When the configuration is verified successfully, click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Set up a virtual machine template for the Azure Slave plugin
trans-unit.target: Set up a virtual machine template for the Azure Slave plugin

trans-unit.source: A virtual machine template defines the parameters the plugin will use to create a slave node on Azure.
trans-unit.target: A virtual machine template defines the parameters the plugin will use to create a slave node on Azure.

trans-unit.source: In the following steps we'll be creating template for an Ubuntu VM.
trans-unit.target: In the following steps we'll be creating template for an Ubuntu VM.

trans-unit.source: In the Hudson dashboard, click **Manage Hudson**.
trans-unit.target: In the Hudson dashboard, click **Manage Hudson**.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Configure System**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Configure System**.

trans-unit.source: Scroll down the page to find the **Cloud** section.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down the page to find the **Cloud** section.

trans-unit.source: Within the **Cloud** section, find **Add Azure Virtual Machine Template** and click the **Add** button.
trans-unit.target: Within the **Cloud** section, find **Add Azure Virtual Machine Template** and click the **Add** button.

trans-unit.source: Specify a cloud service name in the **Name** field.
trans-unit.target: Specify a cloud service name in the **Name** field.

trans-unit.source: If the name you specify refers to an existing cloud service, the VM will be provisioned in that service.
trans-unit.target: If the name you specify refers to an existing cloud service, the VM will be provisioned in that service.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, Azure will create a new one.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, Azure will create a new one.

trans-unit.source: In the **Description** field, enter text that describes the template you are creating.
trans-unit.target: In the **Description** field, enter text that describes the template you are creating.

trans-unit.source: This information is only for documentary purposes and is not used in provisioning a VM.
trans-unit.target: This information is only for documentary purposes and is not used in provisioning a VM.

trans-unit.source: In the **Labels** field, enter **linux**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Labels** field, enter **linux**.

trans-unit.source: This label is used to identify the template you are creating and is subsequently used to reference the template when creating a Hudson job.
trans-unit.target: This label is used to identify the template you are creating and is subsequently used to reference the template when creating a Hudson job.

trans-unit.source: Select a region where the VM will be created.
trans-unit.target: Select a region where the VM will be created.

trans-unit.source: Select the appropriate VM size.
trans-unit.target: Select the appropriate VM size.

trans-unit.source: Specify a storage account where the VM will be created.
trans-unit.target: Specify a storage account where the VM will be created.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that it is in the same region as the cloud service you'll be using.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that it is in the same region as the cloud service you'll be using.

trans-unit.source: If you want new storage to be created, you can leave this field blank.
trans-unit.target: If you want new storage to be created, you can leave this field blank.

trans-unit.source: Retention time specifies the number of minutes before Hudson deletes an idle slave.
trans-unit.target: Retention time specifies the number of minutes before Hudson deletes an idle slave.

trans-unit.source: Leave this at the default value of 60.
trans-unit.target: Leave this at the default value of 60.

trans-unit.source: In **Usage**, select the appropriate condition when this slave node will be used.
trans-unit.target: In **Usage**, select the appropriate condition when this slave node will be used.

trans-unit.source: For now, select **Utilize this node as much as possible**.
trans-unit.target: For now, select **Utilize this node as much as possible**.

trans-unit.source: In **Image Family or Id** you have to specify what system image will be installed on your VM.
trans-unit.target: In **Image Family or Id** you have to specify what system image will be installed on your VM.

trans-unit.source: You can either select from a list of image families or specify a custom image.
trans-unit.target: You can either select from a list of image families or specify a custom image.

trans-unit.source: If you want to select from a list of image families, enter the first character (case-sensitive) of the image family name.
trans-unit.target: If you want to select from a list of image families, enter the first character (case-sensitive) of the image family name.

trans-unit.source: For instance, typing **U** will bring up a list of Ubuntu Server families.
trans-unit.target: For instance, typing **U** will bring up a list of Ubuntu Server families.

trans-unit.source: Once you select from the list, Jenkins will use the latest version of that system image from that family when provisioning your VM.
trans-unit.target: Once you select from the list, Jenkins will use the latest version of that system image from that family when provisioning your VM.

trans-unit.source: OS family list
trans-unit.target: OS family list

trans-unit.source: If you have a custom image that you want to use instead, enter the name of that custom image.
trans-unit.target: If you have a custom image that you want to use instead, enter the name of that custom image.

trans-unit.source: Custom image names are not shown in a list so you have to ensure that the name is entered correctly.
trans-unit.target: Custom image names are not shown in a list so you have to ensure that the name is entered correctly.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, type **U** to bring up a list of Ubuntu images and select **Ubuntu Server 14.04 LTS**.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, type **U** to bring up a list of Ubuntu images and select **Ubuntu Server 14.04 LTS**.

trans-unit.source: For **Launch method**, select **SSH**.
trans-unit.target: For **Launch method**, select **SSH**.

trans-unit.source: Copy the script below and paste in the **Init script** field.
trans-unit.target: Copy the script below and paste in the **Init script** field.

trans-unit.source: The **Init script** will be executed after the VM is created.
trans-unit.target: The **Init script** will be executed after the VM is created.

trans-unit.source: In this example, the script installs Java, git, and ant.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the script installs Java, git, and ant.

trans-unit.source: In the **Username** and **Password** fields, enter your preferred values for the administrator account that will be created on your VM.
trans-unit.target: In the **Username** and **Password** fields, enter your preferred values for the administrator account that will be created on your VM.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Verify Template** to check if the parameters you specified are valid.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Verify Template** to check if the parameters you specified are valid.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Save**.

trans-unit.source: Create a Hudson job that runs on a slave node on Azure
trans-unit.target: Create a Hudson job that runs on a slave node on Azure

trans-unit.source: In this section, you'll be creating a Hudson task that will run on a slave node on Azure.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you'll be creating a Hudson task that will run on a slave node on Azure.

trans-unit.source: In the Hudson dashboard, click **New Job**.
trans-unit.target: In the Hudson dashboard, click **New Job**.

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for the job you are creating.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name for the job you are creating.

trans-unit.source: For the job type, select **Build a free-style software job**.
trans-unit.target: For the job type, select **Build a free-style software job**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Ok**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Ok**.

trans-unit.source: In the job configuration page, select **Restrict where this project can be run**.
trans-unit.target: In the job configuration page, select **Restrict where this project can be run**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Node and label menu** and select **linux** (we specified this label when creating the virtual machine template in the previous section).
trans-unit.target: Select **Node and label menu** and select **linux** (we specified this label when creating the virtual machine template in the previous section).

trans-unit.source: In the **Build** section, click **Add build step** and select **Execute shell**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Build** section, click **Add build step** and select **Execute shell**.

trans-unit.source: Edit the following script, replacing **(your github account name)**, **(your project name)**, and **(your project directory)** with appropriate values, and paste the edited script in the text area that appears.
trans-unit.target: Edit the following script, replacing **(your github account name)**, **(your project name)**, and **(your project directory)** with appropriate values, and paste the edited script in the text area that appears.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Save**.

trans-unit.source: In the Hudson dashboard, find the job you just created and click on the **Schedule a build** icon.
trans-unit.target: In the Hudson dashboard, find the job you just created and click on the **Schedule a build** icon.

trans-unit.source: Hudson will then create a slave node using the template created in the previous section and execute the script you specified in the build step for this task.
trans-unit.target: Hudson will then create a slave node using the template created in the previous section and execute the script you specified in the build step for this task.
